alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 14 at 3:41AM MST until December 15 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * WHERE...In Utah, Southeast Utah and Canyonlands/Natural Bridges. In Colorado, Paradox Valley/Lower Dolores River and Four Corners/Upper Dolores River. * WHEN...The strongest wind gusts are expected early Wednesday morning with the passage of a cold front. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects and bring down tree limbs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is likely to mix with the winds after the cold front passage. Travel may be hazardous at times with snow limited visibility and the cold air moving in behind the front leading to quickly freezing roads.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. People, especially those with respiratory illnesses, heart disease, the elderly, and children are recommended to stay indoors and avoid prolonged outdoor exercise or heavy exertion due to wind-blown dust.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River
